description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Syl DeLeon December 13, 2016 SEO for .edu Sites: How to Defeat 7 Common Problems Content Marketing | Advanced SEO Educational sites can constitute an SEO mess that seems impossible to untangle. Use these smart content marketing solutions from Syl DeLeon to show your .edu site who's boss. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 9, 2016 The 10 Types of Content That Work Best for SEO Content Marketing | Whiteboard Friday | SEO Basics After analyzing hundreds of SERPs, Rand has identified and classified the 10 distinct content types that work best for SEO. In this Whiteboard Friday, he explains those types and how to use them effectively in your content marketing strategy. Read this post By: Chelsea Scholz December 8, 2016 How Marketing Like Netflix Will Save Your Lead-Gen Strategy Content Marketing | Video If the last few years have taught us anything, it's that people want their content ASAP and all at once. Improve your lead-gen strategy and conversions by axing webinars and marketing a bit more like Netflix. Read this post By: Mark Johnstone December 7, 2016 What Link Building Success Really Looks Like Content Marketing | Link Building In this examination of content marketing successes, Mark Johnstone adds more perspective and depth around what successful link building looks like in the wild versus what we might expect. Read this post By: Kerry Jones November 30, 2016 5 Takeaways from Earning Links in 130 Countries Content Marketing | Link Building | International SEO What can you do if link building opportunities are scarce in your country? Kerry Jones shares five solutions learned from building links in over 130 different countries. Read this post By: Tomas Vaitulevicius November 16, 2016 The SEO Myth of Going Viral Content Marketing | Link Building Plot twist: What if "going viral" wasn't all it's cracked up to be? Using evidence from three case studies of well-known content marketing successes, Tomas Vaitulevicius makes the case that perhaps the SEO benefit of viral content isn't as valuable as we think. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 11, 2016 How to Beat Your Competitor's Rankings with More *Comprehensive* Content Whiteboard Friday | Content Marketing Rand's three-step process for improving your "content comprehensiveness" will help you answer all of a searcher's questions and help you beat out competitors for those higher-ranking positions. Read this post By: Ronell Smith November 8, 2016 5 Tips to Get Off the Content Marketing Struggle Bus & Create Content Your Audience Will Love Content Marketing | SEO Basics If your brand is struggling to get a handle on what content to create next, it's time to take that concern off the table by learning how to produce content the audience craves. Read this post By: Pete Watson-Wailes October 24, 2016 A Guide on How to Use XPath and Text Analysis to Pitch Content SEO Basics | Content Marketing | SEO Tools One of the things we as marketers often need to do is pitch content concepts to sites. To make this easier, you want to pitch something on-topic. To do that more effectively, I decided to spend some time creating a process to help in the ideation stage. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 21, 2016 Content Gating: When, Whether, and How to Put Your Content Behind an Email/Form Capture Whiteboard Friday | Content Marketing Have you ever considered gating your content to get leads? Whether you choose to have open-access content or gate it to gather information, there are benefits and drawbacks you should be aware of. In today's Whiteboard Friday, Rand weighs the pros and cons of each approach and shares some tips for improving your processes. Read this post By: Kerry Jones October 19, 2016 All Content is Not Created Equal: Comparing Results Across 15 Verticals Content Marketing Are you holding your content marketing to unrealistic standards? Success can mean wildly different things depending on your vertical. Let data be your guide: Fractl shares insights from an analysis of over 340 client campaigns. Read this post By: Serge Stefoglo September 28, 2016 How a Single Piece of Content Increased Our DA by +7 Points [Case Study] Content Marketing | Link Building While working on their client's site, Sergey and his team knew optimization alone wouldn't be enough to move the needle. They needed links. With one big, successful content piece, they drove their domain authority up by 7 in 4 months. Here's how. Read this post By: Kelsey Libert September 27, 2016 3 Surprising Lessons From Building 26,000 Links Content Marketing | Link Building What insights can you learn from analyzing 26,000 links? The experts at Fractl share the most valuable takeaways from taking a keen eye to the links they've earned from hundreds of content marketing campaigns. Read this post By: Todd McDonald September 13, 2016 How to Generate Content Ideas Using Screaming Frog in 20(ish) Minutes Content Marketing | Advanced SEO | SEO Tools It's no easy task to keep your ideas fresh and relevant. Tap into your audiences' conversations in a mere 20 minutes with the help of tools like Screaming Frog. Read this post
